https://offchain.medium.com/introducing-nova-arbitrum-anytrust-mainnet-is-open-for-developers-9a54692f345e

TLDR: Arbitrum is launching a new chain "Nova". It has a committee of 20 nodes and a trust assumption of at least 2 of them being honest. Instead of posting full transactions on L1, the committe posts only "Data Availability Certificates" (= signing of transaction batch hashes?) and exposes servers to download the data by hash. If less than 19 committees are honest, the chain falls back to a normal rollup. At least 2 of commitee members are supposed to be honest. The chain is meant for gaming and social applications.
